column6: So what do you guys think?
I think plan two would be the best one
Plan 1 is the only one that fits what was described as a tight yearly budget.
That's what I think too
Plan 1
city is on a tight budget
but there is a possibility of being charged a high fine if there is any waste with plan 1
Agreed Calvin. I don't see them coming up with the extra $22,000+
it's risky
It's already been accounted for in plan 1.
where's the fine?
the waste disposal cost?
i think the carbon tax basically makes it carbon neutral,.. right?
Waste disposal and carbon waste disposal fees are already included.
If the main energy source releases toxic chemical waste, there is a waste disposal cost of $2/MWh.
Not to mention, if they went over, there's still about $300k less.
They may be included but those cost could go up a lot over the years and might not be coverage under budget
And that cost has been included
But we're not being asked for a long-term, just a decision based on one year of budget and one year of data.
ok, well at least we're just on plans 1 and 2  right?
I think so. 3 and 4 are definitely out of budget.
it does say carbon neutral and economical in the long run
Agree 3/4 are out
I agree with three and four out as well
OK. We're about halfway through the 15 min.
Which plan and who's writing? :)
Plan 1 also satisfies the stable and reliable energy for the hospitals. you can't always count on wind all the time
its not saying they are using wind all the time
but i think wind makes the power costs variable
the most out of all 4
I know but it says stable and reliable- coal power has been around long enough that it isn't new with "bugs" to work out
let's vote at 5 minutes
That's fine.
perfect
im good with that
Apparently only 4 of us want the 50 cent bonus for discussing. ;-)
I think plan 1 factors in everything negative into the cost
Agreed.
cost is $816 M + 60M in "penalties"
Overall I think long term plan 2 is the best- but with the cost being the main factor, I think Plan 1 is the way to go
